frog.screen

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • frog.screen.Screen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BossGui, BossRoom, FrogDungeon, GameOverScreen, InfoScreen, LoadGameScreen, MenuScreen, PauseScreen, ShopkeeperGui, VictoryScreen

    public abstract class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
implements ButtonListener
    Abstract screen. Subclasses will be used by PApplets to draw navigation screens within the program.
    Author:
    Justin Hwang

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        The statements in the setup() function execute once when the program begins

      • draw

        public void draw()
        The statements in draw() are executed until the program is stopped. Each statement is executed in sequence and after the last line is read, the first line is executed again.

      • getSurface

        public DrawingSurface getSurface()
        Returns the DrawingSurface that this Screen exists inside of
        Returns:
        DrawingSurface object

      • updateButtons

        public void updateButtons(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY,
                          boolean mousePressed)
        Updates the Buttons
        Parameters:
        mouseX - x-coordinate of the mouse, using actual coords, not assumed
        mouseY - y-coordinate of the mouse, using actual coords, not assumed
        mousePressed - True if mouse is currently pressed down, false if not
